title: Over 47,000 Transport Workers In Telangana Are 'Sacked' Says Government As Bus Strike Continues
text:
In an unprecedented move, the Telangana government has said that the more than 47,000 striking employees of the road transport corporation have been terminated from service.

This came after the October 5 deadline set by the KCR government for the striking employees to return to work expired.

According to reports only around 1,200 of the employees returned to work on Sunday. Telangana Chief Minister KCR said that the government has not dismissed the striking employees, but they dismissed themselves.

“There is no need for the government to dismiss the others. The government has also not dismissed them. By staying away from work, the rest have dismissed themselves. It is considered ‘self-dismissal’. They did not heed the request of the government or the management to report for work,” KCR said adding that the recruitment of new employees would start immediately to run the buses.

The employees of the RTC had gone on a mass strike over several demands and alleging that that KCR had failed to fulfill the promises he had made before Telangana attained statehood.

Even as the employee unions are set to move the court against the sacking, KCR is defiant and said as far as the government is concerned there are only 1200 employees left with the TSRTC.

BCCL

The government is also trying to have a maximum of its fleet on the road. According to officials, as many as 1,029 buses were pressed into service on Monday to tackle the rush. While 691 buses were from TSRTC’s fleet, 338 were on hire basis.
